tidbits.title: Cradle of Humanity
tidbits.description: Ethiopia is often regarded as the 'Cradle of Humanity' due to the discovery of some of the earliest human ancestors, including 'Lucy,' a 3.2 million-year-old skeleton.

tidbits.title: Unique Calendar
tidbits.description: Ethiopia follows its own unique calendar, with 13 months and New Year (Enkutatash) falling in September, celebrating with vibrant cultural festivities.

tidbits.title: Diverse Landscapes
tidbits.description: The country boasts diverse landscapes, from the lush highlands of the Simien Mountains to the otherworldly Danakil Depression, offering a range of natural wonders.
